title: BaGua-Based Creative Instructional Design Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Emphasis on creative problem-solving competencies in blended (face-to-face/online) environments; development of flexible design strategies responding to post-pandemic educational changes

learning_goals: Propose three or more instructional designs that integrate conflicting educational requirements using the Yin-Yang contrast principle of BaGua

Creative educational activities can be designed by applying the BaGua’s eight problem-solving strategies to the four stages of the Dick and Carey Model (design development, planning, implementation demonstration, and effectiveness verification).
At least two technology integration strategies can be proposed to address learners’ emotional anxiety factors in blended learning environments.

resources: Educational scenario database for case analysis

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
